Spritz is a browser based reactive event stream library in the tradition of the ReactiveX philosophy.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
spritz
The core elements of the Spritz library.

Spritz is a browser based reactive event stream library in the tradition of the ReactiveX philosophy. Applications are created by composing event streams and Spritz shines when used to coordinate multiple independent event streams. The library aims to simplify asynchronous programming and minimize the hazards of side effects and mutable shared state.

The developer experience is a primary concern in Spritz without sacrificing end-user experience. This means that extensive invariant checking occurs in development mode but is optimized away in production builds of the library. Spritz is under heavy development, and sometimes the documentation does not keep up to date. The goal of the library is to be easy to use, and this includes clear and concise documentation. If something is unclear please report it as a bug because it is a bug. If a new user has a hard time, then we need to fix the problem.

Spritz was developed to be used within the browser. It is designed to be transpiled down to reasonably efficient javascript with a small code size. Often the library chose a smaller code size over a better runtime speed under the assumption that the browser speed is more likely to be negatively impacted by increased code size due to download time, js parse time and js compile time than it would be due to a slight runtime performance degradation although the Stream.compose(Function) escape hatch has been added so that users can write their own operators when performance is critical.

Concepts

Events

An event is an action or occurrence recognized by software that occurs at a particular instant in time. An event can be thought of as a pair containing a value element describing the event data and a time element that indicates the time at which the event is emitted. Both the value and time elements are just as important.

An example of an event may be a network message. Another example is a user interaction such as a keypress or a mouse button click. An event could also be triggered by passing of time in a timer such that an event is generated every N milliseconds.

Streams

A stream is a time-ordered sequence of events. For example, a stream of click events from a UI control or a stream of messages over a WebSocket. Operators filter, transform and combine input streams. An operator never modifies the input stream but instead creates a new stream.

A listener or a subscriber in Spritz parlance receives the events and reacts to events as they occur. The events are received in the order in which they are emitted and at the time they are emitted.

A stream can also send other signals to the subscriber indicating that the stream has completed or that the stream has failed. If the subscriber receives these signals then they will not receive any more events from the stream and must handle that appropriately. Thus streams may be infinite, finite, or may fail.

Event Sources and Stream Operators

The library includes construction methods to create event sources combined with a powerful set of operators for filtering, transforming and merging event streams. The construction methods and operators available are as follows:

  • Construction: Methods to construct a stream
  • Peeking: Observing items and signals as they pass through the stream
  • Filtering: Operators that remove items from a stream based on some criteria
  • Rate Limiting: Rate limiting operators
  • Slicing: Cutting the stream into sequential segments
  • Transformation: Operators that change the form of items and signals passing through the stream
  • Merging: Combining multiple streams into a single stream
  • Accumulating: Accumulate items and signals and emit events based on accumulation process
  • Scheduling: Operators that change the VirtualProcessorUnit on which events and signals are emitted or the time at which events and signals are emitted
  • Error Handling: Operators that respond to errors
  • Unknown: Unknown how we should categorize this operator at this stage

Construction

Methods to construct a stream

  • Stream.of(values): Creates a stream that emits the parameters as items and then emits the completion signal
  • Stream.of(name,values): Creates a stream that emits the parameters as items and then emits the completion signal
  • Stream.empty(): Creates a stream that emits no items and immediately emits a completion signal
  • Stream.empty(name): Creates a stream that emits no items and immediately emits a completion signal
  • Stream.ofNullable(value): Creates a stream that emits the value parameter as an item if the value is not null
  • Stream.fail(error): Creates a stream that emits no items and immediately emits an error signal
  • Stream.fail(name,error): Creates a stream that emits no items and immediately emits an error signal
  • Stream.fromCollection(values): Creates a stream that emits items of the supplied collection
  • Stream.fromCollection(name,values): Creates a stream that emits items of the supplied collection
  • Stream.fromStream(stream): Creates a stream that emits items from the supplied Stream
  • Stream.fromCallable(callable): Creates an infinite stream that emits items from the Callable parameter
  • Stream.fromCallable(name,callable): Creates an infinite stream that emits items from the Callable parameter
  • Stream.fromSupplier(supplier): Creates an infinite stream that emits items from the Supplier parameter
  • Stream.fromSupplier(name,supplier): Creates an infinite stream that emits items from the Supplier parameter
  • Stream.fromRunnable(runnable): Creates a stream that completes when the Runnable parameter completes running
  • Stream.fromRunnable(name,runnable): Creates a stream that completes when the Runnable parameter completes running
  • Stream.generate(supplier,period): Creates an infinite stream that emits items from the Supplier parameter at specified period
  • Stream.generate(name,supplier,period): Creates an infinite stream that emits items from the Supplier parameter at specified period
  • Stream.never(): Creates a stream that emits no items, never completes and never fails
  • Stream.never(name): Creates a stream that emits no items, never completes and never fails
  • Stream.range(start,count): Create a stream that emits a sequence of numbers within a specified range
  • Stream.range(name,start,count): Create a stream that emits a sequence of numbers within a specified range
  • Stream.periodic(period): Create a stream that emits sequential numbers every specified interval of time
  • Stream.periodic(name,period): Create a stream that emits sequential numbers every specified interval of time
  • Stream.concat(upstreams):
  • Stream.merge(upstreams):
  • Stream.create(createFunction): Creates a stream using a simple function
  • Stream.create(name,createFunction): Creates a stream using a simple function

Peeking

Observing items and signals as they pass through the stream

  • onSubscribe(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before signalling subscription
  • onSubscribe(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before signalling subscription
  • afterSubscribe(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after signalling subscription
  • afterSubscribe(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after signalling subscription
  • tap(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before each item is emitted
  • tap(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before each item is emitted
  • peek(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before each item is emitted
  • peek(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before each item is emitted
  • onNext(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before each item is emitted
  • onNext(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before each item is emitted
  • afterNext(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after each item is emitted
  • afterNext(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after each item is emitted
  • onError(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before signalling error
  • onError(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before signalling error
  • afterError(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after signalling error
  • afterError(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after signalling error
  • onComplete(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before signalling complete
  • onComplete(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before signalling complete
  • afterComplete(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after signalling complete
  • afterComplete(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after signalling complete
  • onCancel(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before the stream is canceled by a downstream stage
  • onCancel(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before the stream is canceled by a downstream stage
  • afterCancel(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after the stream is canceled by a downstream stage
  • afterCancel(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after the stream is canceled by a downstream stage
  • onTerminate(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before signalling complete or signalling error
  • onTerminate(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter before signalling complete or signalling error
  • afterTerminate(action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after signalling complete or signalling error
  • afterTerminate(name,action): Return a stream containing all the items from this stream that invokes the action parameter after signalling complete or signalling error

Filtering

Operators that remove items from a stream based on some criteria

  • filter(predicate): Filter the items emitted by this stream using the specified Predicate
  • filter(name,predicate): Filter the items emitted by this stream using the specified Predicate
  • ofType(type): Remove items in the stream that are not instances of the specified type and return a stream of the specified type
  • ofType(name,type): Remove items in the stream that are not instances of the specified type and return a stream of the specified type
  • ignoreElements(): Drop all items from this stream, only emitting the completion or failed signal
  • ignoreElements(name): Drop all items from this stream, only emitting the completion or failed signal
  • distinct(): Filter the items if they have been previously emitted
  • distinct(name): Filter the items if they have been previously emitted
  • skipRepeats(): Drops items from the stream if they are equal to the previous item emitted by the stream
  • skipRepeats(name): Drops items from the stream if they are equal to the previous item emitted by the stream
  • filterSuccessive(predicate): Filter consecutive items emitted by this stream using the specified SuccessivePredicate
  • filterSuccessive(name,predicate): Filter consecutive items emitted by this stream using the specified SuccessivePredicate

Rate Limiting

Rate limiting operators

  • sample(samplePeriod): Sample items from stream emitting the first item and the last item in each sample period
  • sample(name,samplePeriod): Sample items from stream emitting the first item and the last item in each sample period
  • sample(samplePeriod,emitInitiatingItem): Sample items from stream emitting the last item in each sample period
  • sample(name,samplePeriod,emitInitiatingItem): Sample items from stream emitting the last item in each sample period
  • throttle(timeout): Drops items emitted by a stream that follow emitted item until the timeout expires
  • throttle(name,timeout): Drops items emitted by a stream that follow emitted item until the timeout expires
  • throttle(timeoutForItemFn): Drops items emitted by a stream that follow emitted item until the timeout returned by the function expires
  • throttle(name,timeoutForItemFn): Drops items emitted by a stream that follow emitted item until the timeout returned by the function expires
  • debounce(timeoutForItemFn): Drops items emitted by a stream that are followed by newer items before the timeout returned by the function expires
  • debounce(name,timeoutForItemFn): Drops items emitted by a stream that are followed by newer items before the timeout returned by the function expires
  • debounce(timeout): Drops items emitted by a stream that are followed by newer items before the given timeout value expires
  • debounce(name,timeout): Drops items emitted by a stream that are followed by newer items before the given timeout value expires

Slicing

Cutting the stream into sequential segments

  • take(maxSize): Truncate the stream, ensuring the stream is no longer than maxSize items in length
  • limit(maxSize): Truncate the stream, ensuring the stream is no longer than maxSize items in length
  • limit(name,maxSize): Truncate the stream, ensuring the stream is no longer than maxSize items in length
  • first(): Pass the first item downstream, complete the downstream and cancel the upstream
  • firstOrError(): Pass the first item downstream, complete the downstream and cancel the upstream
  • firstOrDefault(defaultValue): Pass the first item downstream, complete the downstream and cancel the upstream
  • skip(count): Drop the first count items of this stream
  • skip(name,count): Drop the first count items of this stream
  • last(): Drop all items except for the last item
  • lastOrError(): Drop all items except for the last item
  • lastOrDefault(defaultValue): Drop all items except for the last item
  • last(maxElements): Drop all items except for the last maxElements items
  • last(name,maxElements): Drop all items except for the last maxElements items
  • takeLast(maxElements): Drop all items except for the last maxElements items
  • skipWhile(predicate): Drop items from this stream until an item no longer matches the supplied predicate
  • skipWhile(name,predicate): Drop items from this stream until an item no longer matches the supplied predicate
  • skipUntil(predicate): Drop items from this stream until an item matches the supplied predicate
  • skipUntil(name,predicate): Drop items from this stream until an item matches the supplied predicate
  • takeWhile(predicate): Return items from this stream until an item fails to match the supplied predicate
  • takeWhile(name,predicate): Return items from this stream until an item fails to match the supplied predicate
  • takeUntil(predicate): Return items from this stream until an item matches the supplied predicate
  • takeUntil(name,predicate): Return items from this stream until an item matches the supplied predicate

Transformation

Operators that change the form of items and signals passing through the stream

  • ofType(type): Remove items in the stream that are not instances of the specified type and return a stream of the specified type
  • ofType(name,type): Remove items in the stream that are not instances of the specified type and return a stream of the specified type
  • map(mapper): Transform items emitted by this stream using the mapper function
  • map(name,mapper): Transform items emitted by this stream using the mapper function
  • mapTo(value): Transform items emitted by this stream to a constant value
  • mapTo(name,value): Transform items emitted by this stream to a constant value
  • concatMap(mapper): Map each input item to a stream and then concatenate the items emitted by the mapped stream into this stream
  • mergeMap(mapper,maxConcurrency): Map each input item to a stream and then flatten the items emitted by that stream into this stream
  • mergeMap(mapper): Map each input item to a stream and flatten the items emitted by the inner stream into this stream
  • switchMap(mapper): Map each input item to a stream and emit the items from the most recently mapped stream
  • exhaustMap(mapper): Map each input item to a stream and emit the items from the most recently mapped stream

Merging

Combining multiple streams into a single stream

  • concatMap(mapper): Map each input item to a stream and then concatenate the items emitted by the mapped stream into this stream
  • mergeMap(mapper,maxConcurrency): Map each input item to a stream and then flatten the items emitted by that stream into this stream
  • mergeMap(mapper): Map each input item to a stream and flatten the items emitted by the inner stream into this stream
  • switchMap(mapper): Map each input item to a stream and emit the items from the most recently mapped stream
  • exhaustMap(mapper): Map each input item to a stream and emit the items from the most recently mapped stream
  • append(streams): Emit all the items from this stream and then when the complete signal is emitted then merge the items from the specified streams one after another until all streams complete
  • prepend(streams): Merge the items from the specified streams before the items from this stream sequentially
  • startWith(value): Emit the specified item before emitting items from this stream
  • endWith(value): Emit the specified item after emitting items from this stream

Accumulating

Accumulate items and signals and emit events based on accumulation process

  • scan(accumulatorFunction,initialValue): Apply an accumulator function to each item in the stream emit the accumulated value
  • scan(name,accumulatorFunction,initialValue): Apply an accumulator function to each item in the stream emit the accumulated value

Scheduling

Operators that change the VirtualProcessorUnit on which events and signals are emitted or the time at which events and signals are emitted

  • subscribeOn(virtualProcessorUnit): Invoke the Subscriber#onSubscribe(Subscription) on upstream on the specified VirtualProcessorUnit
  • subscribeOn(name,virtualProcessorUnit): Invoke the Subscriber#onSubscribe(Subscription) on upstream on the specified VirtualProcessorUnit
  • observeOn(virtualProcessorUnit): Emit signals and item on the specified VirtualProcessorUnit
  • observeOn(name,virtualProcessorUnit): Emit signals and item on the specified VirtualProcessorUnit

Error Handling

Operators that respond to errors

  • onErrorResumeWith(streamFromErrorFn): When an upstream emits an error then replace upstream with the stream returned by the supplied function rather than emitting an error to downstream
  • onErrorResumeWith(name,streamFromErrorFn): When an upstream emits an error then replace upstream with the stream returned by the supplied function rather than emitting an error to downstream
  • onErrorReturn(value): When an upstream emits an error then emit supplied value and complete the stream
  • onErrorReturn(name,value): When an upstream emits an error then emit supplied value and complete the stream
  • repeat(maxErrorCount): When an upstream emits an error then re-subscribe to upstream rather than emitting an error to downstream
  • repeat(name,maxErrorCount): When an upstream emits an error then re-subscribe to upstream rather than emitting an error to downstream
  • repeat(): When an upstream emits an error then re-subscribe to upstream rather than emitting an error to downstream

Unknown

Unknown how we should categorize this operator at this stage

  • errorIfEmpty(errorFactory): Emit an error if the stream completes and no items were emitted
  • errorIfEmpty(name,errorFactory): Emit an error if the stream completes and no items were emitted
  • publish(): Publish emitted items and signals to the specified subject
  • publish(name): Publish emitted items and signals to the specified subject
  • defaultIfEmpty(defaultValue): If upstream emits no items and then completes then emit the defaultValue before completing this stream
  • defaultIfEmpty(name,defaultValue): If upstream emits no items and then completes then emit the defaultValue before completing this stream
  • timeout(timeoutTime): Signals error with a TimeoutException if an item is not emitted within the specified timeout period from the previous item
  • timeout(name,timeoutTime): Signals error with a TimeoutException if an item is not emitted within the specified timeout period from the previous item
  • forEach(action):
  • terminate(terminateFunction):
